courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Mathematics Curriculum and Teaching: Basic Theory and Practice
courses.description: Major topics of discussion include: aims and objectives of mathematics education; the evolution of mathematics curricula in the current educational reform; theories of mathematics learning and instruction; models of mathematics teaching; preparation of mathematics lessons and classroom techniques through micro-teaching; use of instructional aids and manipulatives; catering for learning diversities; and evaluation of learning effectiveness.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Understand the content and the rationale behind the Hong Kong mathematics curriculum;

2. Construct lesson plans by selecting and sequencing “big ideas” to teach in school mathematics;
courses.course_syllabus:
1. The goal of mathematics education

2. The mathematics curriculum

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Mathematics Curriculum and Teaching: Basic Theory and Practice
courses.description: This is the first of a series of two related courses on curriculum and teaching methods in mathematics, with a focus on Hong Kong school context. These two courses aim to help students to be familiar with the current curricular issues and develop essential pedagogical skills and strategies in mathematics. Throughout these two courses, the students will have hands-on practice opportunities which aim to help students to reflect on their own teaching beliefs and teaching styles in mathematics. The first course focuses on developing the general knowledge and skills a teacher needs for organizing an effective mathematics lesson. A wide range of general topics of mathematics pedagogy will be covered, including: aims and objectives of mathematics education; the evolution of mathematics curricula in the current educational reform; theories of mathematics learning and instruction; models of mathematics teaching; preparation of mathematics lessons and classroom techniques through microteaching; use of instructional aids and manipulatives; catering for learning diversities; and evaluation of learning effectiveness.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details

1. The goal of mathematics education in secondary school

2. The curriculum of secondary school mathematics

3. Theories of learning mathematics

4. Models of mathematics learning

5. Planning mathematics lessons

6. Micro-teaching

7. Mathematics assessment

8. Group presentation

9. Conclusion

5. 數學課堂規劃

6. 微格教學

8. 小組匯報

9. 總結

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Mathematics Curriculum and Teaching: Instructional Technology and Design of Teaching Activities
courses.description: This course aims to help students become familiar with the current curricular issues and develop essential pedagogical knowledge and skills in mathematics. Throughout the course, students will gain hands-on practice opportunities, while applying specific pedagogical knowledge and skills in mathematics. In particular, emphasis will be put on designing tool-based mathematical rich learning tasks and activities. Tools refer to mathematical embedded teaching and learning aids which can be physical or digital. Mathematics specific instructional technology (such as dynamic geometry software) will be one of the major focuses. The discussion will extend from activities inside mathematics classroom to mathematics-related extra-curricular activities, including STEM learning activities. A wide range of general topics of mathematics pedagogy will be covered, including: preparation of mathematics lessons and classroom techniques through micro-teaching; use of information and communication technology; tool-based mathematics tasks and activities; cross-disciplinary mathematics-related activities; and professional development of mathematics teachers.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to be able to:

1. Design rich mathematical tasks and learning activities for meeting learning diversity in mathematics classrooms;
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
1. preparation of mathematics lessons and classroom techniques through micro-teaching;

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Mathematics Curriculum and Teaching: Instructional Technology and Design of STEM Learning Activities
courses.description:
This is the second of a series of two related courses on curriculum and teaching methods in mathematics, with a focus on Hong Kong school context. These two courses aim to help students become familiar with the current curricular issues and develop essential pedagogical skills and techniques in mathematics. Throughout these two courses, the students will have hands-on practice opportunities

which aim to help students to reflect on their own teaching beliefs and teaching styles in mathematics. The second course focuses on specific pedagogical knowledge and skills in mathematics. In particular, emphasis will be put on designing tool-based mathematical rich learning tasks and activities. Tools refer to mathematical embedded teaching and learning aids which can be physical or digital. The use of instructional technologies (such as dynamic geometry software, 3d printing, and coding) for designing mathematics and/or STEM learning tasks and projects will be some of the major focuses of this course. The discussion will extend from activities inside mathematics classroom to extra-curricular and cross-disciplinary mathematics learning activities, including STEM learning activities. A wide range of general topics of mathematics pedagogy will be covered, including: preparation of mathematics lessons and classroom techniques through micro-teaching; use of information and communication technology; tool-based mathematics tasks and activities; cross-disciplinary mathematics-related activities; and professional development of mathematics teachers.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details
1. Use of mathematics specific ICT
2. Tool-based task design in mathematics pedagogy
3. Micro-teaching
4. Games and mathematics related activities
5. Cross-disciplinary activities in mathematics.
6 Professional development of mathematics teachers

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而作調校
1. 資訊與傳意科技的運用
2. 基於教學工具的數學教學任務設計
3. 微格教學
4. 數學遊戲及相關活動
5. 跨科目的數學活動
6. 數學教師之專業成長

Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Mathematical Literacy and Problem Solving
courses.description: Major topics include development of mathematical literacy for all, including approaches of mathematical exploration, understanding, reasoning, and communication; an understanding of mathematical problem solving through analysis of misconception and cognitive difficulties encountered in the development of mathematical skills and ability.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to be able to:

1. Demonstrate knowledge for teaching of the fundamental concepts and theories from the topics as included in this Course.
2. Utilize various problem-solving and critical-thinking techniques to set up and solve real-world applications.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
1. Understanding mathematical literacy
2. Problem solving in mathematics
3. Children’s early numerical abilities
4. Development of arithmetic abilities
5. Development of spatial sense and geometric concepts
6. Student misconceptions in learning mathematics
7. The acquisition of cognitive skills in mathematics
8. Multiple representations in mathematics education
9. Student conceptions of mathematics
10. Making mathematical connections

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而作調校
1. 數學素養的認識
2. 數學解難
3. 學童的數值能力
4. 算術能力的發展
5. 空間感及幾何概念的發展
6. 數學認知技巧
7. 學生對數學學習的誤解
8. 數學教育中的多重表徵
9. 學生對數學的見解
10. 建立數學連結

courses.description: Mathematical literacy is the knowledge and application of basic mathematics in daily life. Problem solving is one of the competencies needed for mathematics literacy. It is the centre of mathematics activities. One of the major aims of school mathematics education is to equip the next generations to be mathematically literate and have mathematical problem solving competency. This course aims to help develop students’ knowledge on mathematical literacy and theories about mathematical problem solving. It covers a wide range of topics related to this area, including: development of mathematical literacy for all through approaches of mathematical exploration, understanding, reasoning, and communication; development of mathematical problem solving abilities; and analysis of misconception and cognitive difficulties encountered in the development of mathematical skills and ability in students.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details
1. Development of mathematical sense
2. Development of algebraic thinking
3. Development of spatial sense and geometric concepts
4. Student’s misconceptions in learning mathematics
5. The acquisition of cognitive skills in mathematics
6. Representations in the teaching and learning of mathematics
7. Problem solving in mathematics
8. Students’ views of mathematics
9. Implications for teaching mathematics

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: The Teaching of Algebra and Calculus
courses.description: This course focuses on the teaching of algebra and calculus in school mathematics. Ranging from the basic concept of introducing unknowns and designation of numbers by symbols at primary school level to systems of algebraic equations or equations of higher degrees at upper secondary level, algebraic methods permeate through the whole school mathematics curriculum. In this course, topics of algebra and calculus in the mathematics curriculum are analyzed from multiple perspectives in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, psychology of learning, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Emphasis is placed on how students can develop their algebraic and calculus ways of thinking gradually through the curriculum. Through different learning activities that include the use of information technology resources, student teachers will develop their conceptual understanding and frameworks for effective instructional design in these curriculum topics.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
1. Algebra and its curriculum
2. Teaching of algebra
3. Learning of algebra
4. Assessing algebra learning
5. Helping students with learning difficulties in algebra
6. Calculus and its curriculum
7. Teaching of calculus
8. Learning of calculus
9. Effective teaching methods for calculus
10. Technology use in algebra and calculus education

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: The Teaching of Number and Algebra
courses.description: This course focuses on the teaching of number and algebra in secondary school mathematics. It is concerned about the basic concept of introducing unknowns and designation of numbers by symbols, systems of algebraic equations or equations of higher degrees, and algebraic methods permeate through the whole school mathematics curriculum. In this course, topics in number and algebra in the mathematics curriculum at secondary school level are analyzed from multiple perspectives, that is, in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, psychology of learning, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Emphasis is on how school students can develop their algebraic ways of thinking gradually through the curriculum. Through different learning activities which include the implementation of available information technology resources, student teachers will develop their conceptual skills and frameworks for effective instructional design in these curriculum topics.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to be able to:

1. Demonstrate knowledge for teaching of the fundamental concepts and theories from the topics as included in this Course.
2. Utilize various problem-solving and critical-thinking techniques to set up and solve real-world applications
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
1. Bridging between number and algebra from epistemological perspective
2. Pedagogical method of number and algebra
3. Algebraic way of thinking in problem solving

1. 從認識論角度看數與代數之關係

3. 以代數思維解決問題

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: The Teaching of Number and Number Sense
courses.description: This course focuses on an important aspect in mathematics education, namely, the understanding and cultivation of number and number sense, which is a major aim in primary school mathematics education. It is concerned about school children’s learning of basic quantitative skills, from counting objects to the four rules of arithmetic, both in exact calculations and in estimation. In this course, related topics in the mathematics curriculum are analysed from multiple perspectives, that is, in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, psychology of learning, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Through different learning activities which include the implementation of available information technology resources, student teachers will develop their conceptual skills and frameworks for effective instructional design in curriculum topics related to number and number sense.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Demonstrate knowledge for teaching of the fundamental concepts and theories from the topics as included in this Course.

2. Utilize various problem-solving and critical-thinking techniques to set up and solve real-world applications
courses.course_syllabus:
1. The nature of number

2. Number Sense

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Elementary Mathematics from an Advanced Standpoint
courses.description: The famous mathematician Felix Klein pointed out that there is a disconnection between university mathematics education and elementary mathematics education. He called this phenomenon “double discontinuity”. As a student of B.Ed. in Mathematics and Mathematics Education and a pre-service secondary mathematics teacher, there is a need to break through this phenomenon. This is precisely the focus of this course. In this course, the connection between university mathematics and secondary school mathematics are analyzed from multiple perspectives, that is, in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, psychology of learning, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Through different learning activities, student teachers will review different dimensions of secondary school mathematics curriculum, including algebra, geometry, statistics and calculus, from an advanced standpoint. Their pedagogical content knowledge in mathematics will be developed.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details
1. Intuition and rigorousness as the dual nature of mathematics
2. The relationship between compulsory part and extended part of senior secondary mathematics curriculum
3. Bridging between algebra and calculus from the pedagogical standpoint
4. Bridging between intuitive geometry and deductive geometry from the pedagogical standpoint
5. Bridging between data handling and quantitative analysis from the pedagogical standpoint

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而作調校
1. 直觀與嚴謹作為數學之雙重特性
2. 新高中數學科必修部分與延伸部分之關係
3. 從教育角度看代數及微積分之關係
4. 從教育角度看直觀幾何及演繹幾何之關係
5. 從教育角度看數據處理及量化分析之關係

Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: The Teaching of Probability and Statistics
courses.description: This course focuses on the teaching of probability and statistics in school mathematics. At primary school level, statistics is introduced in relation to real life applications. At higher grade levels, statistics is taught with more computational elements and their interpretations, and real-world experiences in probabilistic events are basis for developing a formal understanding of probability in mathematics. In this course, topics in probability and statistics in the mathematics curriculum are analysed from multiple perspectives, that is, in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Emphasis is on the development of stochastic thinking among school students. Through different learning activities which include the implementation of available information technology resources, student teachers will develop their conceptual skills and frameworks for effective instructional design in these curriculum topics.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to be able to:

1. Demonstrate knowledge for teaching of the fundamental concepts and theories from the topics as included in this Course
2. Utilize various problem-solving and critical-thinking techniques to set up and solve real-world applications
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
1. Teaching of Statistics
2. Teaching of Probability
3. Bridging between statistics and probability from the pedagogical standpoint

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: The Teaching of Probability and Statistics
courses.description: This course focuses on the teaching of probability and statistics in secondary school mathematics. At junior secondary school level, statistics is introduced in relation to real life applications. At higher grade levels, statistics is taught with more computational elements and their interpretations, and real-world experiences in probabilistic events are basis for developing a formal understanding of probability in mathematics. In this course, topics in probability and statistics in secondary school mathematics curriculum are analyzed from multiple perspectives, that is, in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Emphasis is on the development of stochastic thinking among school students. Through different learning activities which include the implementation of available information technology resources, student teachers will develop their conceptual skills and frameworks for effective instructional design in these curriculum topics.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details.
1. Teaching of statistics
2. Teaching of probability
3. Bridging between statistics and probability from the pedagogical standpoint
4. Conclusion

1. 統計的教學
2. 概率的教學
3. 從教育角度看統計與概率之關係
4. 總結

Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: The Teaching of Spatial Sense and Geometry
courses.description: This course focuses on the teaching of geometry in school mathematics. At junior primary school level, spatial sense is to be cultivated through concrete activities with shapes and solid forms. At higher grade levels, there is a gradual shift from synthetic or empirical geometry to deductive geometry. In this course, topics in geometry in the mathematics curriculum are analysed from multiple perspectives, that is, in terms of the mathematics content knowledge, psychology of learning, pedagogical approaches, and epistemological relationships between mathematical concepts involved. Emphasis is on the development of spatial sense and geometrical thinking among school students. Through different learning activities which include the implementation of available information technology resources, student teachers will develop their conceptual skills and frameworks for effective instructional design in these curriculum topics.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Demonstrate knowledge for teaching of the fundamental concepts and theories from the topics as included in this Course.

2. Utilize various problem-solving and critical-thinking techniques to set up and solve real-world applications
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Contemporary Issues in Mathematics Education
courses.description: The context of mathematics education has evolved rapidly, giving rise to advances in theories and practices among the community of mathematics educators and researchers. This course surveys selected current topics and trends affecting mathematics education. It aims to expand students’ horizons in frontier research and contemporary issues in mathematics education. The specific topics of this course vary from year to year, as chosen by the instructor. Topics and issues may include, but are not limited to: mathematics assessment, historical and cultural aspects of mathematics, cognitive and affective aspects of mathematics, mathematics teaching for disadvantaged groups and language issues in mathematics education. The goal of examining these selected topics is to empower students to become potential agents and leaders of curricular change in their future practice.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to be able to

1. Demonstrate understanding of relevant ideas and knowledge on a particular topic or issue in mathematics education

2. Reflect and apply relevant ideas and knowledge on a particular topic or issue to mathematics learning and teaching.

完成這科後，學生期望能夠：

1. 展示對某特定數學教育的課題或議題的認識

2. 反思及運用某特定數學教育的課題或議題的知識於數學的學與教

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Action Research in Mathematics Classroom
courses.description: This course is designed to familiarize students with the nature of action research in reflective and critical perspectives. This course also aims at familiarizing learners with the theoretical and practical aspects of action research as applied to mathematics education and with different types of data collection and analysis in a classroom setting.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
1. Background and characteristics of action research
2. The cyclic nature of action research and framing of problem
3. The issues as related to evidence gathering
4. Action research designs and common mathematics education research methodologies
5. The discipline of noticing
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.recommended_readings:
Recommended readings would depend on individual instructors

1. Ainley, J. (1999). Who are you today? Complementary and conflicting roles in school-based research. For the Learning of Mathematics, 19(1) 39-47

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Mathematics Teaching Project Report
courses.description: This course aims at providing students with guidelines in developing their own research plans in reflecting and critically assessing their professional practices by adopting multiple research perspectives for inquiry in education in general and in mathematics education in particular.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite:(a) Either BMED3010 or BMED3011 AND (b) BMED4510
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to be able to:

1. be aware of the importance and relevance of research ethics
2. be able to design and construct their own research plans in accordance with multiple research methodologies.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course of respective instructor for details:
Independent study：Meeting and reporting of the progress to the Supervisor

courses.subject: BMED
courses.title: Independent Study I
courses.description: The Independent Study is an elective course during the final year of our BEd. Programme. It has a course weighting of 3 credit units. The workload and expectations are similar to those of the equivalent number of one course. It aims to develop the student’s ability to conduct independent research in the area of mathematics and mathematics education. The development, undertaking and completion of the Study are the culmination of the BEd. learning experience and the student must take and pass the course of BMED4510 Action Research in Mathematics Classroom (數學教學行動研究) prior to enrolling to this course. It is intended to be a largely independent piece of work, which is aimed at combining and utilizing the research skills and knowledge developed and gained from other relevant previous courses, and using these to complete a piece of original research within the student’s area of interest. The course structure of Independent Study I (BMED4910) is same as Independent Study II (BMED4920) and the latter serves as an extension of the former.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: BMED3010 or BMED3011, and BMED4510.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Demonstrate the application of knowledge and method to the investigation of a specific area within the field of mathematics and mathematics education

2. Identify an issue to which solutions and/or recommendations can be addressed; and produce a written report which sets out clearly the aims, context, content and outcome of the exercise.
courses.course_syllabus:
Independent Study: Meeting and reporting of the progress to the Supervisor

與指導老師會面及匯報有關進度

Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.
